content:
Diagnosis:

Malignant melanoma right calf, pT3b (3.8mm, ulcerated) with right inguinal nodal metastasis

Previous treatment:
WLE and SLNB right calf 12 Jan 2024
Completion right groin dissection 26 Jan 2024 (1/12 nodes positive)
Started adjuvant Dabrafenib/Trametinib 1 Feb 2024

Current situation:
Pre cycle 4 review

Clinical Assessment:
Tolerating treatment well after initial pyrexia resolved with 1 week dose interruption in cycle 1. Performance status 0. No new skin lesions. Groin wound well healed with no lymphoedema. Recent CT shows no evidence of distant disease.

Bloods today show normal LFTs, normal CK. Previous ejection fraction stable at 55%.

Plan:
Continue with cycle 4 Dabrafenib/Trametinib at full dose
Repeat staging CT after cycle 6
Monthly dermatology surveillance to continue
Follow up in 4 weeks with blood tests

cancer_timeline.value: Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy right calf
Completion right groin dissection with 1/12 nodes positive
Dose interruption for 1 week in cycle 1 due to pyrexia
CT shows no evidence of distant disease

patient_facts.value: Groin wound well healed with no lymphoedema
Normal LFTs, normal CK, ejection fraction stable at 55%

status_updates.value: Stage III melanoma on adjuvant targeted therapy. Tolerating treatment well after initial pyrexia resolved, no evidence of recurrence
Initial pyrexia resolved after 1 week dose interruption in cycle 1
Continue with cycle 4 Dabrafenib/Trametinib at full dose
Follow up in 4 weeks with blood tests, monthly dermatology surveillance to continue
